intro: Jonesiella pattersonii, commonly known as the Patterson's Jonesiella, is a rare and lesser-known plant species belonging to the family Restionaceae. It is native to the island of New Guinea and thrives in humid, coastal environments. The plant is characterized by its compact, shrub-like growth habit and narrow, grass-like leaves. It produces small, inconspicuous flowers that are typically clustered in dense inflorescences. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a vulnerable species in its native range.
